As a Domain Admin, I can login to my Domain from the Horizon login page.
Enter the domain ("TESTDOMAIN")
Enter the domain admin user ("USER1")
Enter the password of the above user
Click "Connect"

As a Domain Admin, I can view my Domain.
Click Identity -> Domains in the sidebar

As a Domain Admin, I can view all of the projects in my Domain.
Click Identity -> Projects in the sidebar

As a Domain Admin, I can create a Project.
Click Identity -> Projects in the sidebar Click "Create Project" above the projects list/table Note Domain ID and Name immutably set to the new domain ("TESTDOMAIN") Enter a project name ("PROJECT1") and description Note the "Enabled" checkbox is checked by default If necessary while creating the new project, you can click on the "Project Members" tab to add domain users to the project as well as adjust their roles. Click "Create Project" button

As a Domain Admin, I can edit a Project.
Click Identity -> Projects in the sidebar Click the "Edit Project" action in the project actions dropdown Name, Description and the Enabled checkbox attributes can be updated. If necessary while updating the project, you can click on the "Project Members" tab to addusers to or remove users from the project as well as adjust their roles. Click "Save" once changes are complete.

As a Domain Admin, I can create a User.
Click Identity -> Users in the sidebar Click "Create User" above the users list/table Note Domain ID and Name immutably set to the new domain ("TESTDOMAIN") Enter a user name ("USER2"), description, email address, password Select the primary project for the user Note the role "_member_" is preselected Note the "Enabled" checkbox is checked by default Click "Create User" button

As a Domain Admin, I can edit a User.
Click Identity -> Users in the sidebar Click the "Edit" action for the user in the Users table Update the user name, description, email address and/or primary project as necessary Click "Update User" button

As a Domain Admin, I can add Users/Members on the Project.
Click Identity -> Projects in the sidebar Click "Manage Members" in the actions column for the project In the left column, click the plus ("+") beside the user that should be added to the project. Click the "Save" button

As a Domain Admin, I can remove Users/Members from the Project.
Click Identity -> Projects in the sidebar Click "Manage Members" in the actions column for the project In the right column, click the minus ("-") beside the user that should be removed from the project. Click the "Save" button

Domain Admins can be project members for projects in their domains.
Click Identity -> Projects in the sidebar Click "Manage Members" in the actions column for the project Ensure the Domain Admin ("USER1") exists in the right column as a project member and has the "_member_" role selected.
